violations_detected.title: Script violations
violations_detected.evidence: Improper greeting. Operator says only 'А.' without introducing company name, operator name, or offer to help. Required: proper greeting format with company identification and offer of assistance.

violations_detected.title: Echo method not used
violations_detected.evidence: Customer name 'Dmitry' collected at 0:04.686 (word-level timestamp). Operator uses name later ('Dmitry, we can hold for you' at 1:37.353) but never repeats it back for verification or asks confirmation question like 'Верно?' Required: repeat-back + explicit confirmation request.

violations_detected.title: No thank you for waiting
violations_detected.evidence: Information search completed (0:52.868 'Now I'll check' to 0:56.202 'No, they don't have stock'). Operator provides search result but does not thank customer for waiting. Required: gratitude expression after search completion.

violations_detected.title: Script work
violations_detected.evidence: Information provided but script adherence issues: greeting incomplete (only 'А.'), no company name mentioned, no operator name provided, improper opening structure. Closing initiated by customer, not operator.

coaching_priorities.recommendation: Begin every call with full greeting: introduce company name, your name, and offer to help (e.g., 'Добро пожаловать в [Company], это [Your Name], чем я могу помочь?')

coaching_priorities.issue: Echo method not used for customer name
coaching_priorities.recommendation: When customer provides name, repeat it back and ask for confirmation: 'Your name is Dmitry, is that correct?' or 'Dmitry, верно?' Wait for customer confirmation before proceeding.
After completing information search, always thank customer for waiting: 'Thank you for your patience' or 'Спасибо за ожидание' before providing results.

Follow complete script structure: proper opening with company/name identification, structured information delivery, proper closing initiated by operator (not customer). Maintain conversation control throughout.

1.1.evidence: No profanity or harsh language detected. Professional tone maintained throughout.

2.1.evidence: No call dropout or service refusal. Operator provided information and service completed normally.

3.1.evidence: Customer request (tire availability information) was resolved. Operator provided details about product availability, pricing, location, and benefits.

3.3.evidence: No confidential information disclosed. No office numbers, internal codes, or unauthorized data sharing detected.

3.6.evidence: Operator announced search ('Now I'll check') and appeared to verify information before providing details.

4.1.evidence: No difficult customer behavior detected. Customer is polite and cooperative. Text indicators do not suggest operator frustration.
4.1.note: Full assessment requires audio for tone analysis

5.1.evidence: Core information provided: product model, pricing, availability date (November 7), location (Vasileva 37), and benefits. Project mandatory fields cannot be fully validated without configuration.

6.1.evidence: No critical silence. Longest gap during search was 3.3 seconds. Customer did not hang up. Call ended normally with customer goodbye.

7.1.evidence: Improper greeting with only 'А.' No company name, operator name, or offer to help provided.

7.2.evidence: Customer name provided without echo verification. Name used later but never repeated back with confirmation question.

7.3.evidence: Intro at 0.35s (< 5s), call ends after final speech with minimal delay.

7.4.evidence: No interruptions of customer speech detected. Operator allows customer to complete statements.

9.1.evidence: Search duration 3.3 seconds, well under 40-second threshold. Complex database lookup completed efficiently.

9.3.evidence: Search completed at 0:56.202 but operator does not express gratitude for waiting. No 'спасибо за ожидание' or equivalent phrase detected.

10.2.evidence: Script adherence issues: improper greeting, no company/operator identification, closing initiated by customer rather than operator.

10.3.evidence: Customer name used consistently. Dialogue maintains logical flow. However, operator does not initiate proper closing.
10.3.note: Partial assessment - closing control transferred to customer

10.6.evidence: Information provided includes product model (Kumho Wintercraft Ice White 32), specifications (175/65/14), pricing (6039 RUB), availability date (November 7), location (Vasileva 37), and benefits. Information appears complete and accurate.
10.6.note: Partial assessment without project configuration for mandatory fields

positive_observations: Efficient information search completed in 3.3 seconds
Provided comprehensive product information including pricing and availability details
Professional and polite tone maintained throughout
Handled customer decision to decline holding gracefully without pressure
No rudeness or harsh language detected

data_quality.confidence_notes: Word-level JSON provided adequate precision for echo method assessment. Timestamps from both VTT and word-level JSON align well. Call is short, providing clear analysis.
